Module com.example.navalbattleminiproject3
Package com.example.navalbattleminiproject3.model.board.Board

Interface IBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
BoardAdapter, BotBoard, PlayerBoard
public interface IBoard
Interface representing the operations available on a game board. Provides methods for spawning boats, shooting, and managing the board state. Default implementations for some methods are provided.

  • Method Details

    • shootInOtherBoard

      boolean shootInOtherBoard(BoardAdapter attackedBoard, int row, int column)
      Shoots at another board at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      attackedBoard - the BoardAdapter representing the attacked board.
      row - the row index of the target cell.
      column - the column index of the target cell.
      Returns:
      true if the shot was successful, false otherwise.

    • randomShootInOtherBoard

      int[] randomShootInOtherBoard(BoardAdapter attackedBoard)
      Performs a random shot on another board and returns the coordinates of the shot.
      Parameters:
      attackedBoard - the BoardAdapter representing the attacked board.
      Returns:
      an array containing the row and column of the shot.

    • spawnBoat

      boolean spawnBoat(int row, int column, int direction, int boatType)
      Spawns a boat at a specified position with a given direction and type.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index to spawn the boat.
      column - the column index to spawn the boat.
      direction - the direction of the boat (0 for horizontal, 1 for vertical).
      boatType - the type of boat to spawn.
      Returns:
      true if the boat was successfully spawned, false otherwise.

    • randomBoatGeneration

      String[] randomBoatGeneration(int boatNumber)
      Generates a random boat position on the board.
      Parameters:
      boatNumber - the number of positions to generate for the boat.
      Returns:
      an array of strings representing the boat's positions.

    • getBoard

      List<List<Integer>> getBoard()
      Retrieves the current state of the board as a list of lists of integers.
      Returns:
      a List<List<Integer>> representing the current state of the board.

    • getBoardWithBoats

      List<List<Boats>> getBoardWithBoats()
      Retrieves the current state of the board as a list of lists of Boats.
      Returns:
      a List<List<Boats>> representing the board with the boats.

    • isBoatHitted

      default boolean isBoatHitted(List<List<Integer>> hittedBoard, int row, int column)
      Checks if a boat is hit at the specified position on the board.
      Parameters:
      hittedBoard - the board to check.
      row - the row index of the target cell.
      column - the column index of the target cell.
      Returns:
      true if the boat is hit, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      GameException.NoBoardFound - if the board is not found.
      GameException.OutOfBoardPosition - if the position is out of board bounds.

    • setNumberByIndex

      default void setNumberByIndex(List<List<Integer>> board, int number, int row, int column)
      Sets a value at a specific index on the board.
      Parameters:
      board - the board where the value will be set.
      number - the number to set.
      row - the row index where the number will be set.
      column - the column index where the number will be set.

    • getNumberByIndex

      default int getNumberByIndex(List<List<Integer>> board, int row, int column)
      Gets the number at a specific index on the board.
      Parameters:
      board - the board to get the value from.
      row - the row index to get the value from.
      column - the column index to get the value from.
      Returns:
      the value at the specified position on the board.

    • setObjectByIndex

      default <T> void setObjectByIndex(List<List<T>> board, T object, int row, int column)
      Sets an object at a specific index on the board.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object.
      Parameters:
      board - the board where the object will be set.
      object - the object to set.
      row - the row index where the object will be set.
      column - the column index where the object will be set.

    • getObjectByIndex

      default <T> T getObjectByIndex(List<List<T>> board, int row, int column)
      Gets an object at a specific index on the board.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object.
      Parameters:
      board - the board to get the object from.
      row - the row index to get the object from.
      column - the column index to get the object from.
      Returns:
      the object at the specified position on the board.

    • getDirectionByPosition

      default int getDirectionByPosition(String[] boatPosition)
      Determines the direction of the boat based on its positions.
      Parameters:
      boatPosition - an array of boat positions represented as strings.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the direction (0: horizontal, 1: vertical).

    • allowedBoatPositionByNumber

      default boolean allowedBoatPositionByNumber(List<List<Integer>> board, int row, int column, int direction, int boatType)
      Checks if a boat can be placed at a specified position on the board.
      Parameters:
      board - the board to check for available positions.
      row - the starting row index for placing the boat.
      column - the starting column index for placing the boat.
      direction - the direction of the boat (0: horizontal, 1: vertical).
      boatType - the size of the boat.
      Returns:
      true if the boat can be placed at the specified position, false otherwise.

    • showBoard

      default <T> String showBoard(List<List<T>> board)
      Displays the current state of the board.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements on the board.
      Parameters:
      board - the board to display.
      Returns:
      a string representation of the board.

    • accessingBoardComprobation

      default <T> void accessingBoardComprobation(List<List<T>> board, int row, int column)
      Verifies if the board, row, and column are valid.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the elements on the board.
      Parameters:
      board - the board to verify.
      row - the row index to verify.
      column - the column index to verify.
      Throws:
      GameException.NoBoardFound - if the board is null.
      GameException.OutOfBoardPosition - if the row or column is out of bounds.
